ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Screenwriting for a mid-sized story (20-40 pages). Coverage experience and ability to provide helpful criticisms to classmates.

I became much more acquainted with formatting and really cemented those skills after intro. I also got a lot of experience and writing about and critiquing other peoples materials which helps me develop my own work.
This course was great for developing my skills as a writer and storyteller; the collaborative atmosphere and intensive structure really helped me improve.
learned how to workshop scripts, better intuition for what makes a screenplay work and what doesn't
I continued to develop my screenwriting skills in a longer script and how to prove helpful coverage and feedback on my classmates' work.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths are the peer feedback sessions. Weaknesses are that the class has very little structure. We just come in and talk.

A strength is reading other peoples work. Its good to constantly interact with art and multiple visions. I dont think necessarily writing about everyones script is that useful outside of getting used to the form because it causes me to look at the same aspects of a script every time I read something which can cause me to miss other things.
This course thrives on its collaborative aspects; I really enjoyed the group discussion style and got a lot of useful criticisms from it. I really enjoyed the course structure!

strengths: high quality workshop discussion, talented people to learn from! weaknesses: although it's hard to get started writing early, I think it would have helped to start workshopping scripts (or 2 scripts instead of 1) a couple weeks earlier so we wouldn't have to squeeze 3 in a day at the end
The strength of this class is the workshop format and your classmates' feedback. You're free to write about whatever you want and it always generates interesting discussion.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to someone interested in the screenwriting senior thesis. If you want to learn the basics of screenwriting, the intro class is more helpful.
I would recommend it to any potential screenwriters. Its always good to get credit for polishing your craft.
I would recommend it to any aspiring writers/screenwriters looking to improve!
yes, I think it's true that "anyone can write a screenplay" and this class is welcoming and understanding enough to give helpful critiques for anyone interested in writing one.
Yes, if you're doing screenwriting for the film major or just looking to continue developing your creative writing skills
